channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Nationwide anti-ICE protests call for accountability after Renee Good's death
item.description: Activist organizations are planning at least 1,000 protests and vigils this weekend. Officials in major cities cast Saturday's demonstrations as largely peaceful.
item.content:encoded:
Activist organizations are planning at least 1,000 protests and vigils this weekend. Officials in major cities cast Saturday's demonstrations as largely peaceful.

(Image credit: Ben Hovland)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Veteran actor T.K. Carter, known for 'The Thing' and 'Punky Brewster,' dies at 69
item.description: T.K. Carter gained fame as Nauls the cook in John Carpenter's 1982 horror classic, "The Thing."
item.content:encoded:
T.K. Carter gained fame as Nauls the cook in John Carpenter's 1982 horror classic, "The Thing."

(Image credit: Mary Altaffer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: US launches new retaliatory strikes against ISIS in Syria after deadly ambush
item.description: The U.S. has launched another round of strikes against the Islamic State in Syria. This follows last month's ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and an American civilian interpreter.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. has launched another round of strikes against the Islamic State in Syria. This follows last month's ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and an American civilian interpreter.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: FDA commissioner explains new food pyramid, encourages greater uptake of core childhood vaccines
item.description: Martin Makary, commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration, on the push against ultra processed foods and added sugar, and what that could mean for school lunches and food labels, and says the administration's hierarchy of vaccines is meant to encourage childhood vaccine uptake.
item.content:encoded: Martin Makary, commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration, on the push against ultra processed foods and added sugar, and what that could mean for school lunches and food labels, and says the administration's hierarchy of vaccines is meant to encourage childhood vaccine uptake.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: 6 killed in Mississippi shooting rampage, authorities say
item.description: The alleged gunman, 24, has been charged with murder after the Friday shootings in northeast Mississippi. The victims include his father, uncle, brother and a 7-year-old relative, authorities said.
item.content:encoded: The alleged gunman, 24, has been charged with murder after the Friday shootings in northeast Mississippi. The victims include his father, uncle, brother and a 7-year-old relative, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: The latest updates on the Minneapolis ICE shooting
item.description: The scene in Minneapolis in the days after an ICE agent fatally shot a 37-year-old mother.
item.content:encoded: The scene in Minneapolis in the days after an ICE agent fatally shot a 37-year-old mother.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: A mother and daughter respond to the latest tragedy in Minneapolis
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Heather and Hattie Anderson, a mother and daughter from Minneapolis, about their community, immigration enforcement operations and protests.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Heather and Hattie Anderson, a mother and daughter from Minneapolis, about their community, immigration enforcement operations and protests.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Influencer, White House welfare fraud claims are distorted, but the system has risks
item.description: Federal officials are targeting Democratic-led states over alleged safety-net fraud. Critics worry a drumbeat of unfounded accusations could undermine public trust.
item.content:encoded:
Federal officials are targeting Democratic-led states over alleged safety-net fraud. Critics worry a drumbeat of unfounded accusations could undermine public trust.

(Image credit: Giovanna Dell'Orto)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: New video shows fatal Minnesota ICE shooting from officer's perspective
item.description: The video, published online by a Minnesota-based news site, Alpha News, and reposted by the Department of Homeland Security, shows the shooting from the perspective of the officer who fired the shots.
item.content:encoded:
The video, published online by a Minnesota-based news site, Alpha News, and reposted by the Department of Homeland Security, shows the shooting from the perspective of the officer who fired the shots.

(Image credit: John Locher)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Two parents reflect on giving back after Camp Mystic tragedy
item.description: After deadly floods hit Central Texas in July, families whose daughters died at a sleepaway camp are keeping their legacies alive. We speak to two parents who helped create the Heaven's 27 Foundation.
item.content:encoded: After deadly floods hit Central Texas in July, families whose daughters died at a sleepaway camp are keeping their legacies alive. We speak to two parents who helped create the Heaven's 27 Foundation.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger
